title: Irrigation and clean water bring life back to Jarey (full version)

tasks.task: Build an irrigation system to bring water to agricultural fields and improve farming productivity.
subtasks: Research and design appropriate irrigation systems for the local terrain and water availability.
Mobilize community members to participate in building and maintaining the irrigation system.
Install pipes and channels to divert water from the source to the agricultural fields.
Protect the water source from contamination by fencing and excluding livestock.

tasks.task: Construct and maintain fence around the water sources to prevent animal contamination.
subtasks: Identify suitable fencing materials and designs that are compatible with local resources.
Organize villagers to collaborate in constructing the fence.
Monitor the effectiveness of the fence in maintaining water quality.

tasks.task: Improve sanitation practices among villagers to reduce water contamination.
subtasks: Educate community members about the importance of hygiene and proper waste disposal.
Facilitate the construction of latrines and other sanitation facilities.
Promote the use of organic farming techniques to minimize chemical pollution.

tasks.task: Revive fallow lands and expand agricultural cultivation areas.
subtasks: Conduct soil tests to identify suitable crops for different plots.
Implement techniques to improve soil fertility and water retention.
Seed and plant new crops in the rehabilitated land.

tasks.task: Adapt traditional farming methods with sustainable practices.
subtasks: Learn and apply organic farming techniques.
Practice crop rotation and intercropping to maintain soil health.
Integrate traditional knowledge with modern agricultural practices.

tasks.task: Enhance food security and marketability of agricultural produce.
subtasks: Expand kitchen gardens with diverse vegetable varieties.
Package and sell surplus produce in local markets.
Explore opportunities for exporting produce to wider markets.

tasks.task: Develop community infrastructure to support economic growth.
subtasks: Secure funding for connecting the village to grid electricity.
Plan and construct a farm road to improve access and transportation.
Upgrade community facilities such as schools and health centers.

Then setting up the fence: MAINTASK: Construct and maintain fence around the water sources to prevent animal contamination. Sanitation task: MAINTASK: Improve sanitation practices to reduce water contamination. They might need to build latrines and promote good hygiene. The agricultural expansion is another MAINTASK: Revive fallow lands and expand agricultural cultivation areas. They probably did soil tests, decided on crops, and planted them.
Adapt traditional farming methods with sustainable practices. Which could have subtasks like learning organic techniques, practicing crop rotation, and intercropping.
Enhance food security and marketability of agricultural produce. They started selling in local markets, which is mentioned in the transcript. Maybe they go beyond that now.
Develop community infrastructure to support economic growth. Securing funding for these would be part of that. Upgrading schools is another aspect.

Ensure reliable water supply for agriculture. That includes irrigation and fencing the source. Hmm, so the two MAINTASKs—irrigation and fencing—are related to water management. Then sanitation is a separate MAINTASK. Agricultural expansion might take several tasks: research on crops, improving soil, then planting.
